result.execSummary:
The defendant Trenon D. DENFELD was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling and work towards his high school diploma, GED of HSED.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with any victim unless approved by the agent, except contact with Todd Ward as allowed.

No contact with any of the co-defendants.

Provide a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Under the Huber Law, on count 1 only, to commence immediately upon completion of the jail sentences imposed on 15 CF 162 and 15 CF 163.

Additional two (2) months county jail, under the Huber Law, on count 1 only, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 01-14-15 at 2:00 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of bail jumping and theft.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 01-05-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no contact with Cody Yauch, other than incidental contact through Two Rivers High School.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
